messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] intro and conference question
messages.msgSnippet: ... It is September 16th from 9-4.  It is being set up by Nancy Plent of New Jersey Unschoolers.  I suspect GWS will have signups shortly. As you are from VA,
messages.messageBody:
Debra Caruso wrote:

> David when is the mini conference at Monmouth college,that is only 20
> minutes from my mom,and I would like to find out how to sign up for
> it,Thanks ,Debbie in va

It is September 16th from 9-4. It is being set up by Nancy Plent of New Jersey
Unschoolers. I suspect GWS will have signups shortly.

As you are from VA, note that I am speaking at the Virginia Home Education Assoc.
Conference on September 2, and in Reston (to VA Eclectic Homeschoolers) on
September 5.

david
--
"And the Skylark Sings with Me" is to homeschooling what Tom Paine's "Common
Sense" was to the American Revolution."--Greg Bates, Common Courage Press. To read
a sample chapter or the foreword, and to get information about ordering a signed
copy, visit www.skylarksings.com or send an e-mail to shantinik@...

Jill


--- David Albert <shantinik@...> wrote:
> mrabideau@... wrote:
>
> > Hello all,
> >
> > I have been unschooling forever it seems. I have
> three kids, 10, 9
> > and 4. I am very disappointed that GWS will not
> be holding their
> > annual conference this year. I was wondering if
> there are any other
> > unschooling-type conferences? I may have to put
> together my own...
> >
> > Marie
> >
>
> Dear Marie--
>
> It is true that GWS won't be holding a full
> Conference this year (they
> wanted to do, but the facility hasn't completed
> renovations.) But you
> should know that on September 16, Pat Farenga,
> Susannah Sheffer, and I will
> be doing an all-day "mini-conference" at Monmouth
> College in New Jersey.
>
> I will also be touring the northeast from September
> 1 til the 19th, so if
> you are in that neck of the woods, let me know and
> I'll tell you if I have
> something happening near you.
>
> David Albert
>
> --
> "And the Skylark Sings with Me" is to homeschooling
> what Tom Paine's "Common
> Sense" was to the American Revolution."--Greg Bates,
> Common Courage Press.
> To read a sample chapter or the foreword, and to get
> information about
> ordering a signed copy, visit www.skylarksings.com
> or send an e-mail to
> shantinik@...
>
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] intro and conference question
messages.msgSnippet: ... Dear Marie-- It is true that GWS won t be holding a full Conference this year (they wanted to do, but the facility hasn t completed renovations.)  But you
messages.messageBody:
mrabideau@... wrote:

> Hello all,
>
> I have been unschooling forever it seems. I have three kids, 10, 9
> and 4. I am very disappointed that GWS will not be holding their
> annual conference this year. I was wondering if there are any other
> unschooling-type conferences? I may have to put together my own...
>
> Marie
>

Dear Marie--

It is true that GWS won't be holding a full Conference this year (they
wanted to do, but the facility hasn't completed renovations.) But you
should know that on September 16, Pat Farenga, Susannah Sheffer, and I will
be doing an all-day "mini-conference" at Monmouth College in New Jersey.

I will also be touring the northeast from September 1 til the 19th, so if
you are in that neck of the woods, let me know and I'll tell you if I have
something happening near you.

David Albert

--
"And the Skylark Sings with Me" is to homeschooling what Tom Paine's "Common
Sense" was to the American Revolution."--Greg Bates, Common Courage Press.
To read a sample chapter or the foreword, and to get information about
ordering a signed copy, visit www.skylarksings.com or send an e-mail to
shantinik@...
